summary.p: 8 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 54; Qurʾānic Text: Q 55:33-55:78; 6 lines per page; Dimensions: 255/257 x 184mm; Script style: kūfi D.I.
The fragment Arabe 346 (b) (BNF) probably belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 54
8 fol. 184×255/257 mm (1.39). Support: thin transparent parchment of yellowish color, with traces of polishing. Writing material: dark brown to black ink.
Collation: one quire, fol. 2 and 7, 4 and 5 are bifolia, fol. 1, 3, 6, 8 are singletons with stubs.
I: H1F S H2F H3F S H4F / F5H F6H S F7H F8H S.
Text layout: fol. 1 – 95×169 mm (1.777); fol. 2–8 – 100×180 mm (1.8), 6 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D I. Diacritics: absent. Vocalization: red round dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – golden rosettes (types 3.1.1 and 3.1.2); for groups of five verses – golden letter ﻪ (hā) contoured with ink; for groups of ten verses – round medallions (types 4.A.II, 4.D.II, 3.C.II) in the text line, in gold and colors with the inscribed numbers of verses (اربعون – fol. 3r, خمسون – fol. 4v, ستون – fol. 6v, سبعون – fol. 8r).

Inscriptions: numbers of surahs and verses inscribed in pencil on the upper margins of all sheets in Roman and Arabic letters; verse numbers are also inscribed with ink in the text and in pencil on the margins.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather of the spine?).
Traces of old conservation: remnants of stubs of fol. 1 and 8 are glued to fol.1.

Defects: traces of moisture on fol. 1 and 2, on the upper margins of other sheets; margins damaged probably by rodents; parchment slightly damaged by aggressive ink on fol. 1–2, 4, 7–8; ink peeling off on the flesh side.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the letters “BE”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink and old accession number in red pencil “B. 32”.
Old accession numbers: ВЕ (on the wrapping), B. 32 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–8v. Surah 55, verses 33(33)-78(78). Incipit: والارض فا[نفذوا لا تنفذون] . Explicit: تبارك [اسم ربك] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: probably, Arabe 346b (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
